review_title: tour goes OK, But free flight does not¡
one_reviews_text:
The moment I leave the hangar, my ship does an about turn and I'm just stuck there, with no control, and wondering why the game insists I return to the hangar without letting me explore the solar system as promised.
I've tried rift controller and I just cannot get beyond the hangar exit.
It Does NOT Look REAL PLZ Make It More Real..................................
Help please game want install

The moment I leave the hangar, my ship does an about turn and I'm just stuck there, with no control, and wondering why the game insists I return to the hangar without letting me explore the solar system as promised.
I've tried rift controller, xbox controller, disabling autopilot - nothing seems to make any difference. I just cannot get beyond the hangar exit.
Nil points. Sucky. Will be uninstalling if I don't find out what's going on soon.
The care about details makes this game everything. Scary

I have LOVED this game from the first time it released. I really hope the developer and Oculus would make this available and compatible with the Oculus Quest and Quest 2. More people MUST experience the thrill and the sheer pleasure of navigating our solar system in the experience. I hope my request is noticed to port this to the Quest.
I can´t wait for another sequel whereas you add more hd textures and level of close detail. Still, I had a blast for a couple of bucks. If you love astronomy you must play this!

EDIT - first, i dont know if it's been pointed out, but if you put your controller up to your head, it zooms into wherever you are looking, i did not see any videos of anyone pointing that out, i figured it out by accident. 

question 1) what is INSTAJUMP I found it out around uranus moons.. it's a small purplle star but it's very strange.. I can find no information about it online.. just wondering what it is, I thought it might have been a portal or wormhole or something lol 

question to devs-
would it be possible to get texture packs or something like reshade working with VR games? I have not played this yet, it's downloading and from what i have seen it looks absolutely breath taking, i will update my review once I play it. But, it seems some of the moons when up close aren't as hi def and i'm just curious, for anyone that has a beefy enough pc to handle it, if it would be possible for you to create and we install OPTIONAL texture packs. I think that would be amazing. Maybe even a version where all stars not render in, and only the planet so you could pull more rendering power for viewing the planets/moons?

I was hoping this would feel like real space, but I didn't feel like I was in a massive environment. The controls are pretty good. Visually there are some graphical limitations that really take you out of the experience, like low resolution planet surfaces and weird transitions. A great effort by the developer.

The views and presentation are breathtaking.  Looking out the side of the window as you pass through the rings of Saturn and visit one of its moons is the best of vr.  Sure, I love the games too, but this one's a no-brainer.  Amazing.

AMAZING..yea there are some low poly graphics near planets surfaces but just the sheer feeling it gives you its like being on a ride at a theme park. Learn some new things and enjoy the feeling of space travel and exploring planets and other things i highly suggest Discovering Space for all you do not even have to be a young kid to enjoy.

review_title: An Engaging Tour of the Solar System
one_reviews_text:
I've always been an astronomy fan so when I purchased my Rift S and started perusing the library this title immediately piqued my curiosity. The premise is a natural for VR: you are in a spaceship and can either fly to any planet in the solar system or sit back and enjoy several guided tours of different planets and other heavenly objects.

Graphically, the game looks quite good. Some of the terrain when you do flybys close to the surface of planets or moons could be a little more detailed but the sense of scale is outstanding and some of the vistas, like travelling thru the rings of Saturn are downright breathtaking.

For $9.99 the experience is a great value if you are into astronomy or space exploration. It's one of my favorite titles so far.

This is by far my favorite space app...and I love space. Buy it and go for a tour around the solar system. Today I flew for 2 hours and 1.8 mil Km. 

I want to see some updates for it. Improve the passenger models, add more details to the ships etc.

I am a little dissappointed with this title. This feels like an early beta that could have been done better. 
The graphics are pretty nice but I just don't get the sense of scale I was anticipating. The planets just feel small and are not textured with much detail at all when you go near the surface. The lighting is done well, texture and scale lacking.

Could someone please explain the flashes of light zipping past the shuttle craft?  I know a bit about astronomy and I can't think of anything that would cause that.  They can't be meteors as meteors don't light up until they enter the atmosphere (from friction in the air).  They can't be cosmic rays because the astronauts said they only noticed them when their eyes were shut because they were so faint.  Are these a graphic rendering artefact?  Whaaaa???

It really detracts from the immersion.

Addendum - I emailed the devs days ago, asking this same question with no response as of yet.   Come on devs.

review_title: Makes a thinking person question life
one_reviews_text:
So I took a space tour of the earth.  I think I almost cried at the end.  It doesn't have the best graphics.  But if you have ever wondered what it would be like to be on a small spaceship on your own and auto-pilot around our planet and towards the sun and back, then this is for you.  This is as close to a realistic simulation of the that experience as you'll find.  Something about the vastness of the space, the warmth of the sun, the cold of it's shadow, seeing how tiny our planet is, seeing your country in a different light or in darkness, and imagining that you're but a speck from the view up above ... and you will lose yourself.  Question life, and death, your priorities, your beliefs, and everything.  .  Realize your non-importance and do the best you can with that knowledge.

Watch my review & gameplay here: https://youtu.be/J2H0apu_zEI
Top experience very informative and good fun.  Really enjoyed it thanks!

I am enjoying this experience very much. You can choose to just sit back and relax and take a guided narrated tour of the Solar System or take control of your own starship and pilot yourself. The comet encounter is my personal favorite so far. Really impressive.

review_title: This is why you bought your Oculus Rift
one_reviews_text:
This experience hits home what virtual reality is all about. This is an experience that cannot be duplicated as a movie, a painting, a seminar, concert, videogame... and, instead, it combines all of these things into one whole experience. Moreover, it reaches newfound levels that cannot be reached inside fictitious worlds and, especially, within linear games and Hollywood movies, because this allows for free exploration and it is based on our REAL surroundings. Think Google Earth but for our solar system.

The controls are just right. The menus are easy to understand. The narration, although a bit too computer like, is timed very well. Excellent music and polish...

But put all technicalities aside for a moment. What matters most is the emotional response. Nothing can prepare you for the feeling of discoving an ominous comet hurtling silently through the vastness of space, for observing Saturn rise above the horizon of one of its moons, for soaring across the wavy surfaces of Neptune, or launching through the stormy atmosphere of Venus. What you're observing here is our greater surroundings outside of Earth's atmosphere. This experience is all about PERSPECTIVE and you will perceive Earth and the rest of the solar system as you have never experienced it before. If you always dreamed of being an astronaut you will find interest in this title.

Remember that feeling you get when you watched a movie for the first time, or read a book for the first time, or even experienced VR for the first time... well, this brings back that feeling. The more I soared around, the better it got, and I noticed the developer threw in a few things for fun as well, but I won't spoil the surprises here.

Well worth the cost and I hope the developers continue to add to this experience, even beyond Pluto and Charon, as NASA continues to provide back data from its observations. Thank you for making this extraordinary experience. I can only imagine what it will be in 5 or 10 more years.

review_title: A must-have for everybody with VR
one_reviews_text: The journey into Space, in a beautiful, futuristic spaceship. It feels like being there alone on that Journey through Cosmos and Time. I especially love the exploration of Comet. I could fly over fumes from ground, see how huge it is, yet barely visible in Space. I wish this experience was updated in 2019, with more detailed textures, better particle effects, more ships, more details on space objects and... the ability to fly over Earth and other planets. Currently there is no such possibility. I hope the creators do not abandon this product. Please update this, to 2019 quality levels.

I honestly am delighted  with this many VR apps that don't come as close to how good this is.
The narration is excellent and the planet models are fabulous, the atmosphere of Jupiter took myu breath away with the boiling, rolling cloud belts and storms.
Add to that the little easter eggs that add some fun to the whole thing spent 3 hours on my first go and look forward to getting back in and seeing more.
Can't recommend this highly enough.
Nothing to see close up

Never write reviews or any comment for that matter, but this is a project that is so beautiful and touching. You get to pilot a spaceship freely in the solar system without any plan or mission but your own desire for exploration. This is not a game but an experience. Support this awesome experience so that the developers can polish this amazing escape from reality.

Much impressed.

The Breath feature and Window frosting, are good/effective/immersive ...
once I realised what they were.  (Not sinking with my resperation cycle, at firs I was looking for a cracked window.)  An option to turn Breath and Frosting off would be liked by me.  Also I am not a great fan of LENS/Cinamatic/DOF features.  I Just don't Percive like that)

Don't delete items or option but perhaps an options sub menu for effects?

Thanks for a really great app.

Decent game with good graphic and information. The biggest problem with it though is the fact that when flying around space the fastest you can go is the speed of light. This means if you want to fly to Neptune for example you get to sit in the game and watch the stars go by for 15 minutes .. very booring! Its cool that this is built to scale, but who wants to sit still for 15 minutes? They should have a 'warp speed' option for easy exploration.

review_title: High quality VR travel to the planets!
one_reviews_text: This program is quite likely the best reality based VR space simulator that is presently available.   It gives one an accurate idea of how far the planets and moons of our Solar System are from Earth as well as from each other.  The graphics are very good and permit one to view the planets from any desired angle and at any desired size in a 3D format.  The only thing I'd like to see added are some real named stars positioned in such a way as to teach people where the Constellations of the sky are located as one travels through space.
Exellent way to show kids our universe . Exellentn work.

review_title: Great space tour for VR beginners
one_reviews_text:
My favorite educational space experience in VR. Almost all the tours are very interesting and well executed. My favorites are the ones around Jupiter and the "Rosetta" asteroid. There is also a nice free flight mode. And it might be a good appetizer for people who are interested in Elite Dangerous.

A few things that prevent 5 stars:

- Free flight is too slow. Traveling at the speed of light is nice but still not fast enough to get to the outer planets in under 20 minutes.

- The english narrator is ok, but the german one is just horrible. Many sentences don't make any sense. Like some really bad google translation.

- The cockpit and especially the player model could use more finetuning.


But still it's a very impressive piece of work for such a small developer.

review_title: This is the epitomy of space VR
one_reviews_text: Any developer such as UBISOFT for  (Star Trek : Bridge Crew) etc should have this game as point of reference for a space game . The graphics and feeling you are in space and on a shuttle are like no other . Take the Free roam option and fly yourself around . Everything is real size and detailed down to craters. You can fly on to a planet and sit in its craters and the detail is still there . Trully exceptional . I wish you would make a game with this as a base . I would pay good money for anything you make if it is like this ! Thank you

Visiuals are quite stunning.  Motion sickness wasnt that bad considering I'm very susceptible to it.  Only thing is when you get close to a planet, especially earth, there is no detail...only vague forms of land. Astronomers will bet a big kick out of it.
I recently had a crash et tried to reinstall the game. But it doesn't work. What can I do? Thank you!

review_title: If you love space, or are a geek, get it
one_reviews_text: I have played Elite Dangerous before which I loved, but I felt it is more for the content and missions, less for the VR Immersiveness (I still do love it, but I was looking for slightly more made for VR). If you have been looking to explore space in VR but not be working on missions, this is the app for you. It also on top of being awesome to explore our Solar System (yes, only our Solar System), is pretty educational. I actually learned a lot of fun facts about planets and moons I never knew before. And it truly is mindblowing kicking back in some of the premade tours watching some of the prepared views. I also LOVE how some of the planets have moving weather (Jupiter in particular). It really has some convincing graphics. My absolute favorite moment in this simulator was the 2001 Easter Egg. I wont tell you how to get there because it will spoil the surprise, but spend some time observing Jupiter's satellites... I am a huge fan of 2001 so when I saw this easter egg I nearly s**t myself. Let's just say it caught me off guard. The only things I can say would improve the game are if the planets were solid (flying through the planets is a bit immersion breaking), and instead of flying through them you maybe bounce off of the surface if you contact it, or if you touch it softly you can land, and if Earth in particular had more detail. 3D rendered buildings or nature would be pretty awesome. I know it is a lot of work, but maybe just something more to Earth and it would be soo cool. Thanks for the awesome VR experience.

I had  a hunch of things when I watched the planetary guides, but the one with a comet just blew my mind. How complex! How big! I have never seen a space documentary before that introduces us to a comet like that. I paid full 10e for this app and not a second have I regret it. More please!

I really didn't expect much for the price I paid as I've paid more for games/experiences that were just blah.  This is incredible.  BEYOND what I could imagine even.  I have just messed around with it a little and I'm already SO impressed.  I took off in some way cool space ship, quickly got comfortable with navigating, and headed for Jupiter.  When I got there my JAW DROPPED.  I was literally in shock.  Not only was it just cool as anything to be flying in space orbiting a planet (I felt like I was on a star trek mission to some strange planet) but the planet was HUGE and MOVING... I mean like weather!  I even went to the moons and decided to get down to the surface and there's mountains, and terrain and it seems to scale even.  Wow wow wow.  Even the narration is well done and informative.   Hey Developers... how about teaming up with Google Earth so you can explore planet earth, or land your spaceship in your back yard!  GREAT APP
This VR is very very wonderful! I want many people to experience it. For me who is not very good at English, I am anxious for Japanese version.

This is amazing.   Please support this dev.   Would be awesome to have even more details and depth, and length but as it is it's really really good.   Awe inspiring.    Could use a way to pause/resume or go back in case you miss a few words while gawking at everything.

very cool experience and visuals are ok, Using the mid-tourer spaceship has a split screen when looking through the front windows which makes this feature broken. only use the solo ship. Currently there is no support through steam and or the website they have provided to help resolve issues. Buy only when it is on sale, for lack of support it is not worth full price.

I've only had my Oculus a few days, so I'm going through and trying stuff out. I'm a huge space nut, so naturally, I expected to like this. I do really like it for all the reasons others have listed, but also, because it scares me to death! Flying around in space far from Earth is exhilerating/unnerving in and of itself, but approaching a massive planets like Jupiter was downright terrifying.

Wow this experience is amazing, even touching at times! Got it for 3 euros on sale, I would have never tought it was so rich in the exploration and deep in the explanations! Really educational!
And piloting the spaceship is fun too!!!

Simple and fun to fly. Really  nice concept and execution.  Visuals are great (like when you're entering the Earth's atmosphere). Love the music! Sets the mood. 
The only things that I hope will be added are: 
1. being able to manipulate the cockpit controls using Touch controllers to simulte button presses. 
2.  A damage model (if you hit an object i.e. lunar surface you damage your ship).
3. Some random ships, objects (satellites, debris, etc) populating the area.
Aside from these little details, this is well worth the price..
BTW, if you line yourelf up correctly you can dock your ship at the Starcarrier. Cool!
Nice immersive experience somewhat ruined by the awful computer generated narration.  It really needs a human voice to lift it from good to great.
It's worth only for the first guided trip, and there are like 6 more, and free roaming

The developer knows how to make a very good vr experience, the first game that was released was 10/10 for me and this one even surpasses that! unbelievable.. If you own a Rift and you haven't got this one your mother should spank your butt!

I see loads of crappy shooting games sold for 30-40 dollar, this is a humble 10 dollars, but really it should be the other way around. I can see the time that has gone into this project. Information, art,coding everything. again 10/10.

review_title: Amazing, a gem, deserves to be top list.
one_reviews_text:
I came across this somewhat by accident. Wow, after mission ISS and a number of other similar games this tops the tree. This developer deserves a very hefty pat on the back and a high five. A couple of things that aren't obvious when you start playing;
- You can lift your touch controller upto your face to zoom in.
- Joystick is supported, turn off 'touch controller in flight' in the controller config menu.
This has to be the best few pounds I've spent so far since owning a Rift and I have allsorts on Oculus (and Steam). Traversing the solar system and stopping to admire when you want is an absolute pleasure, and if you can't be bothered to pilot, take the guided (fully narrated) tours and sit back and relax. 
I truly think we all need to support this developer. The work he must have put into this is epic and if this is what he can do at this price, who knows what he will come up with next. A total gem. Superb.

this is what i have been looking for. very good.  hope you make more. would like to see renderings of entire galaxy. bought with my credits but will buy more with my own money. this was great. try it!. used excellence for title as to me it means the best of what we can strive for.  excellent is what you can do. good luck to developer.
Game wont download - CANT PLAY at all :(

I have had my Rift for about 2 months now, downloaded free software and purchased software.  Having used VR in numerous programs and software, I have to say that this one tops them all.  THIS is what I got into VR for and I wish I could give it more than 5 stars.  So much work has gone into this title, I can't believe I could purchase it on the cheap!  I highly recommend this to anyone that would like to know more about our solar system.  The educational aspect alone is worth the buy.  Wish I could say more without boring everyone, but this thing is GREAT!
Not as polished as Elite Dangerous but still worth it

review_title: One of my most used apps
one_reviews_text: I f'n love this app. There's something so peaceful and calming about flying your own ship through space (cozy 1-seater or more roomy 5-seater - the SUV of spaceships, and if my dad who lives far away could sit in the passenger seat I'd buy him his own PC and rift just for that). Lots of nice details add to the immersion, like blue shift at high speed and condensation on the windows when you emerge from the dark side of a planet.  You can also take tours on autopilot and just relax, and actually learn something from the narration. There are even a few surprises. UPDATE: There are warp gates! You have to go through them manually, and 'Mode' doesn't seem to work on the big ship, but it's a big help for the smaller one. Also, you can switch seats! In the little ship it puts you outside which is neat but terrifying, but in the big one it's breathtaking, being able to see the view through the canopy or monitors. Just minor issues now - autopilot sometimes sends you into a planet and can't navigate around them, and if you set 'Body' to off in settings, it's still there, morbidly flailing its handless arms your direction looking for its own while you pop about the cabin. Other than that, an immersive masterpiece and the kind of thing VR is made for; I'm hoping for updates to improve the experience even further.
review_feedback: Thanks for the comments.  To help with the long distance travel, go searching for the jump gates.  These are dotted around various planets and form a network of jumps to allow you to quickly hop around.  You can find them using the navigation menu ... use the "mode" button to select "nearest", which will show you the nearest objects around you, which will include the jump gates.  Find one, enter slowly, and hold on !!!

one_reviews_text: Wasted credits. Game won't install.

This app can be used to search the solar system, but also as a relax tool. Go onto autopilot and just stare into the vast nothingness of space. I also enjoy flying on/over planet surfaces, and some more details would be appreciated (hint: Moon and Mars have been completely cartographed).
There's nothing that needs to be changed, but I'm looking forward to see improvements: Like walking around in the start menue hall. I'm missing a backwards gear (could be included in the speed reducer key). Some more buttons in the cockpit to click on with small (even useless) functions would be nice (such as closing windows, set up a light filter making windows darker, show the real computer time). Maybe an entirely new cockpit? Note: sometimes stars have a huge halo of brightness around them, which I think does not look natural. German reader really needs improvement, but I can live with it. (although the automatic speaker skips German ß (ß), which is quite annoying).

review_title: Can't turn off the annoying music
one_reviews_text: I have tried for an hour to turn off the music to no avail. I want peace and quiet out there in space. I go to the sound settings  and set the music to zero but when I start the game the music is still there. This should be a simple thing to fix.
review_feedback: Thanks for highlighting the issue.  This has now been fixed with release R18.

one_reviews_text: This app is my favorite VR experience .. the developers of this deserve a lot of credit  .. The updates that have been made to this program are fantastic .

Update ! - Thank you for making the changes by fixing the passenger s for the larger ship and removing(although it was beautiful to look at) the LM return portion to make the Apollo tour accurate as to how it would look today. I also love the improvements on the "surprises" sprinkled around the solar system. As an educator of Science I would LOVE it if this could be expanded to allow real VR passengers. I can imagine parking the craft, with several of my stduents (in VR) as passengers, hovering above the rings of a gas giant or  with in the Mariner Valley on Mars and discussing their key features and then flying off to the next site of interest. Adding to this "wish list" ; expanding the program to include the ability (through jump gates) to visit some of the Kepler probe star systems and or Nebulae, Black Holes, Neutron stars, and so on. Again, thank you for the upgrades.

Just the right amount of complexity to enjoy exploring the solar system without having to study up on controls forever. Ships look nice and are relatively easy to control. Did come across some bugs. When approaching a planet, sometimes the controls get stuck and I have to press the thumbsticks in to regain control. I've gotten sucked into a planet that way once and didn't know how to get back out. pressing the left thumbstick in seems to sometimes push the POV camera backwards. Being really close to the surface of a planet or moon tends to mess with the throttle control in a way that doesn't feel like gravity influence. Autopilot sometimes fails to approach a jump portal correctly and keeps looping around. Most planets look quite nice and even have nicely animated surface textures but getting really close keeps me wanting for more detail (procedural as in SpaceEngine?) in texture and depth. Engine sounds are wonderfully massaged in along with the seamless throttle up to light speed, but the visual effect of light speed looks a little bit like a bug. I don't know if it's scientifically more accurate than what we are used to from Sci-Fi, but if the rear becomes dark and there is reduced field of view on the sides, shouldn't the front get much brighter instead of turning dark blue and shifting away? Looking forward to updates!
Could anyone help me with the issue of downloading the game ? i will change my review when i fix the problem and actually get a chance to try the game !

A great title. The tours are enjoyable, and could be great for use in education.
Having been into astronomy for 35years, i was grateful that the stars you could see from the cockpit are accurate (unlike some other apps i could mention). Seeing Orion , and the Pleiades (to name just two), in virtual space was great!

review_title: Now thats a great space experience!
one_reviews_text: You will not be disappointed in it for the price!

This is a well made experience. Tours and free flights are both awesome. Especially the free flight is by far the best space sim i have played so far, you really feel like you are in a spaceship. Not to mention its educational. I suggest it!

This is a great experience for those who like space and the wonder of the Solar system.  The free flight mode is where it's at for me; the freedom to seek out the ISS, Hubble and the moon landing site then shoot off through a Star Gate to the outer planets to porpoise throught the rings of Saturn.   Just amazing...

This game is only for people interested in space. There is free flight and tours of the solar system. You can  go through the atmosphere of 3 planets for example venus. This is a sort of walking sim for  space. There is the event horizon space ship next to neptune i believe and other unknown object. There are space loop drives. You are only limited to the solar system. There is no action in this game. If you like walking sims you will like space sims otherwise stay away this is not for you. Get x-rebirth.

Another good game like discovering space is unhearting mars. It has more content 11gb of space. I got it on steam cuz it cost less. Discovering space cost less on oculus store.

I wasnt expecting too much from this on the first go, but wow did it not dissapoint. Take out your own spaceship which you can explore on your own or take a guided tour around our Solar System. I was hooked when the ship would take you down to the planet and fly through the landscape. Well done!
would enjoy to watch this experience but problems with installing the game,  would like a refund if this problem isnt fixed.

If you like space and the universe and would like to feel like you're there in the middle of space, this is for you. You get a free mode that allows you to fly around to planets. Just get close to Saturn or any other, grab a beer, sit on your couch and enjoy the immense pleasure of being in outer space with those wonderful views, doing nothing at all. Incredibly relaxing and immersive.
That being said, the Tour mode is where this app really shines, it will take you around and over planets with the best possible views, you will learn about them and enjoy seeing the solar system in a way you only dreamed about. For me, a really wonderful experience. I hope they will include more planets or longer tours to those already included, I would happily pay for more.
Of all the similar programs I bought or acquired for free, this is the one I kept. You can fly in a big ship or a small ship and either way it will be breathtaking your first time.
This is a great experience. Highly recommended, and at a great price too.

Just like going to space with your own ship, it's beautiful and awesome. When you go very close form the surface of planets, of course the resolution is not perfect, but it's well enough to have a lot of real-life experience!

At first I thougt it's just some space sandbox game, but no, it has some awasome tours that takes you around a very nicely built solar system, with vioce over explaining many details. It's a must have! (Chances are you have a $15 coupon after recent Oculus soft ware glitch, I recommend getting this)

Firstly, it's fantastic being able to fly around/in/about our solar system! The inside of the ship is great and you really get a sence of the sheer size and wonder of the planets and our Sun. 
I'd love to see the Earth in more detail, hitting the atmosphere is great but thats it. Imagine if you could add Google Earth to this!!!!! I'd love to have more ships added (From films!) It's amazing to find the Event Horizon in orbit over Neptune! I really hope that the devs add more features, this really has huge potential. 
Worth the money and with a few patches this could be outstanding. :)
Beautiful!!!!
Complete control of ship, awesome navigation, supreme views and graphics. Totally worth it. I did not experience any motion sickness... which was nice.
want a full refund its boring and not real enough AVOID AVOID

review_title: The best vr game and experience
one_reviews_text: The game is loaded with stuff and the updates always are full of excellent surprises.I supported this game early on and it is well worth it.Praise Jesus!
I would say I am a pretty tough critic, but this experience is wonderful! Some of the views are just spectacular! Great Job!

I've been looking for different VR experiences.  Google Earth is an awesome expereince, but I wanted something more in terms of exploring our solar system.  I then found this app during my search.  I am reminded of when I was a kid at the planetarium, looking up at the stars and being bewildered.  Fast forward to today, you are in a VR ship and can choose between solo flight, or a tour of various locations.  I selected the tour and immediately I got the same feeling I did when I was a kid.  My only complaint was my arms, while resting were bent pointing up, which made for a slight distraction of the enjoyable experience.

If you are a fan of space, enjoy looking up at the stars or interested in the planets in our solar system, then I suggest you click on the Install button RIGHT NOW.  You will not be disappointed in the experience.

First, I love this. Beautiful graphics and really nice spaceships to fly in. Found myself getting a little uneasy flying alone in space. A few minor issues with autodocking and the one person ship. Instead of docking the ship began to spin out of control. Made me a bit sick. A few of the settings don't work. Like the ones mentioned by Milestugo. Over all it is allot of fun. I hope the developers sell add on upgrades that will let us visit places like moon base Alpha or the Star Wars Death Star or Star Trek Enterprise. Looking forward to any upgrades they have.

I love the ability to tour the solar system in reasonable amounts of time. I found going up to .9999c particularlyt cool! I just have a couple of quibbles.
(a) At the Apollo 11 site, the ascent stage should be gone. If it remained there on the lunar surface, there'd be two dead astronauts somewhere around as well. :/
(b) Will there be planetary details added? I went atmospheric at Earth, and everything is just brown and blue. While I found it cool to go in and out of atmsophere, I was hoping to see some cities or something.
Definitely recommended though!

Though not as polished as Elite: Dangerous, this is great fun and quite relaxing.
You can travel at incredible speed and the controls are quite easy.
Tip: I found The Discovery (from 2001: A Space Odyssey) in orbit around Jupiter, and flew around her. Worth the asking price alone.. =)
this is a fantastic experiencebut every time i try to land i fall through the ground

It's like a small scaled Space Engine. With less detail in terrain, but more fleshed out in terms of immersion. (space ship, flying mechanics, interior etc..)

If you're looking for a feeling of travelling through space and seemlessly flying to planets in VR without wanting to having to buy/play a full game like Elite, I highly recommend this one!

Absolutely my favorite VR app! Because it is a Space sim (not space game!) and the controls are very well laid out. Even my non-tech/non-gaming wife quickly got the hang of it. I'd really like some better graphics here and there and perhaps some way to explorer the Solar system together with other VR users. Recommended!

Wish list:
- Add Pluto to the list of Solar bodies to be explored
- Higher resolution textures
- Improved Sun (not so realistic)
- Some space ships here & there for the fun of it (Enterprise, Millenium Falcon etc)
- 67P is very well done, more like this :)
- Distant objects to visit? Like say the Gliese system, Orion nebula, LMC/SMC... ?

Been playing this since an early stage and stoked how it been evolved. Just got this release and it blow my mind how detailed all the textures become and how smooth it runs. Of all ca 100 games and demos I've been playing on the Rift, this is the one I recommend most.

Need to add that I'm running it with the Oculus debug tool with 1.5 supersample and it runs perfect on a 1070gtx with super crisp resolution and details.

review_title: Might become a killer title one day.
one_reviews_text: I don't know how every review for the game is dated from before the game came out. I pretty much bought it as soon as it was on the store and there were reviews from weeks ago. Anyway, one day this could become a must buy, but for now its the only way to tour our solar system casually in vr and stands as a great foundation for something potentially bigger. The game is obviously meant to be educational, but its full of potential. The fact that you can customize a crew to fly with you  already gives me hopes this may become something a little more lively one day.

IT's best space-explore game. It's better than Titan of Space. But texture must be more detailed, and maybe more objects in Solar System you able to explore. Best TOUR in game - Comet 67P, Saturn, Mars, Jupiter. Sometimes is breathtaking look.
A great way to explore the solar system with an amazing amount of detail and even easter eggs to discover!

I have to say this was a surprise. Great graphics and also the ability to fly around the solar system in two different ships as well as some things thrown in for Sci Fi  fans. Great Job...can't wait to see if more is added.

I love this VR stuff, I can't get enough of it and if you go buy this experience (becasue that is what it is - NOT a game) you will be totally blown away.  F...ing brilliant, please keep this one going.
amazing tour around the solar system, educational and good VR
Excellent experience if you are a space fan. Feels like a smaller version of "space engine" in a way.

review_title: Best Flight/Space Sim on the Rift
one_reviews_text: What an amazing VR flight simulator. By far the only thing on my Rift im always coming back to play. Trust me on this its worth every penny of your money. if you wanna spend wisely...heres your chance
A truely amazing experience.
This is the one Rift experience I keep coming back to. Hovering above Mars in my little spaceship, or going around the dark side of the moon...a must have.
If you like space... You need it

This is one the best VR experiences I've ever had and I've been playing everything since the early Rift development kit 1 days. A must have in my books and always looking forward to updates with this game. Do you yourself a favor and try this game out!
